text: Ingvald Tøndel (7 January 1887 - 28 September 1952) was a Norwegian politician for the Christian Democratic Party. He was born in Lensvik. He was elected to the Norwegian Parliament from Sør-Trøndelag in 1945, and was re-elected on one occasion. During his second term, he died and was replaced by Johannes Wigum. Tøndel was a member of Hemne municipality council between 1922 and 1924, and then served as mayor from 1924 to 1934. After World War II he returned as deputy mayor in 1947-1951. Between 1941 and 1949 he was a member of the Diocese Council of Nidaros. ==References== * Category:1887 births Category:1952 deaths Category:Christian Democratic Party (Norway) politicians Category:Members of the Storting Category:Mayors of places in Sør-Trøndelag Category:People from Hemne Category:Norwegian Lutherans Category:20th-century Norwegian politicians
title: Ingvald Tøndel
